nodes.text: Moss chips were a type of simple and healthy wafer snack made from moss or similar green alternatives. The chips were flavorsome and could settle digestive systems upset by more decadent foodstuff. The Artiodac chef Strono Tuggs was not a fan of edible moss until he tried some crispy moss chips made by a group of campers on the moon of Yavin 4.

At some point following the Battle of Takodana in 34 ABY, Tuggs included a recipe for moss chips in his cookbook, The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook, and claimed that the chips were a staple on nearly every planet he had visited. The moss chip recipe in the book originated on the planet Dantooine and substituted leafy greens for moss.

Moss chips originated in the Star Wars Legends continuity, where they first appeared in the 2007 novel Republic Commando: True Colors which was written by Karen Traviss. They were introduced in the new Star Wars canon as a recipe in the 2019 cookbook Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook, which was written by Marc Sumerak and Chelsea Monroe-Cassel. The out-of-universe recipe for the chips requires large kale leaves torn into bite-size pieces and tossed in a mixture of honey, olive oil, white miso paste, ground ginger, and a splash of boiling water before baking.
